snippet: Roman Catholic bishops began mobilizing months ago for a major campaign against a requirement that religious-affiliated institutions cover birth control in their insurance plans.
abstract: Roman Catholic bishops began mobilizing seven months ago for a major campaign against Obama administration's requirement that religious-affiliated institutions cover birth control in their insurance plans: speed and passion behind the bishops’ response reflects their growing sense of siege, and their belief that the space the Catholic church once occupied in American society and the deference it was given are gradually being curtailed by an increasingly secular culture.
lead_paragraph: Roman Catholic bishops began mobilizing months ago for a major campaign against a requirement that religious-affiliated institutions cover birth control in their insurance plans.

headline.seo: Bishops Planned Battle on Birth Control Coverage Rule
headline.main: Bishops Were Prepared for Battle Over Birth Control Coverage
headline.print_headline: Church Battle Over Mandate Was at Ready

keywords.value: United States Conference of Catholic Bishops
keywords.name: organizations
